title.narrative: H&S IR1.2: MULTICOUNTRY-SM&NUTRITION

description.narrative: H&S Programme Component Results (PCR) 1 Intermediate Results (IR) 1.2 MultiCountry T2/T3: Strengthened national capacity to deliver quality and timely Newborn, maternal and Nutrition interventions at health facility and community levels., which contributes to Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: HIV&AIDS Programme Component Results (PCR) 6 IR6.1: By 2017, at least six PICs have PPTCT, HIV Testing & Counselling and ART policies/ guidelines and services in line with the international and global recommendations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: H&S PCR 1 IR 1.2 MultiCountry T2/T3: Strengthened national capacity to deliver quality and timely Newborn, maternal andNutrition interventions at health facility and community levels.

description.narrative: New evidence identifying stunting as a public health concern among children under the age of 5 in Republic of the Marshal Islands spurred positive Government action on child survival and development. Fiji drafted a national Integrated Management of Acute Malnutrition protocol based on global recommendations. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:29/12/2017
